intro: Sebastiania hippophaifolia, commonly known as the yellow starburster, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, waxy texture. Sebastiania hippophaifolia thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils.
